question_sentence: South Carolina defeated UConn in the NCAA women’s basketball title game this week. How many national championships does the program have?
President Joe Biden extended the moratorium on federal student loan payments through:
Which of these did not make this year’s Forbes billionaires list?
Which celebrity couple had a wedding ceremony this week?
choices: Megan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly

question_sentence: A lawsuit filed against Burger King claims the company misled customers by portraying its food in advertisements as:
choices: Less greasy than what customers are served
Much larger than what customers are served
Much smaller than what customers are served
Colored differently than what customers are served

question_sentence: More than 8 million users were possibly affected by a data breach involving a former employee of which app?
Which animal was captured and euthanized after attacking several people, including a lawmaker, on Capitol Hill?
There's been an outbreak of an infectious dog disease in Florida. Which illness is it?
True or False: Rep. Matt Gaetz justified his vote against an insulin cap bill by saying diabetics should lose weight.
Olivia Rodrigo dropped and broke one of her Grammy Awards. How many did she win at this week’s awards ceremony?

Rishi Sunak’s  wife has reportedly saved 'millions' by claiming non-domicile status, which allows non-UK citizens to live in Britain for how many days a year without having to pay tax on foreign earnings?
evidence: Like Sunak’s multimillionaire wife Akshata Murty, high-profile figures including Roman Abramovich have used non-dom status to ‘avoid paying significant sums to HMRC’, The Guardian said

question_sentence: Up to how many nuclear power reactors would be constructed in the UK under Boris Johnson’s plans to accelerate the transition to cleaner energy?
evidence: The government is aiming to source 25% of the UK’s electricity from nuclear power plants by 2050, in part to reduce reliance on Russian fossil fuels

question_sentence: A 19-year-old Irish barista has told how she ended up needing emergency surgery after refusing to do what around her boyfriend of two years?
evidence: Cara Clarke needed her appendix removed after holding in her farts for two years but has vowed to ‘let it out from now on’. For more strange news, sign up for our Tall Tales newsletter

question_sentence: According to latest polls, which rival to Emmanuel Macron was polling almost neck-and-neck with the French president in the run-up to this weekend’s ‘nail-bitingly’ close election?
evidence: Far-right candidate Le Pen and incumbent Macron are among 12 candidates to stand in the election. If no one wins a majority in the first round of voting, the top two candidates compete in a run-off

question_sentence: Western sanctions have been imposed on Vladimir Putin’s daughters Maria Vorontsova and Katerina Tikhonov, whose professions are what?
choices: A teacher and a surveillance specialist
A paediatric endocrinologist and head of an AI institute
A professor of psychology and an oil company boss
An investment trader and a television actor
evidence: The move by the US and EU to impose economic sanctions on Putin’s two daughters ‘is largely a symbolic move since it’s unclear they have significant assets outside of Russia’, said Bloomberg

question_sentence: Technologies including carbon capture and storage (CCS) are ‘likely to be necessary’ to help limit global temperature increases to the Paris Agreement goal of 1.5C, according to a newly published review by which organisation?
evidence: The UN  body said that carbon capture and storage could help to ‘neutralise emissions from new power plants’ but should not be regarded as an alternative to cutting fossil fuel use

question_sentence: What is the name of the campaign group that has been staging rallies around Cornwall as part of a campaign for tougher legislation on second homes?
evidence: First Not Second Homes is calling for compulsory licences for second homes, new planning laws and an end to ‘no-fault’ evictions. To find out more, listen to The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: The leaders of the largest organisation in the Black Lives Matter movement reportedly used how much in donated money to buy a California mansion?
evidence: According to New York Magazine, a mansion was bought ‘in cash’ in October 2020 with money that had been give to the non-profit organisation Black Lives Matter Global Network Foundation

question_sentence: Who was tipped as the new favourite to replace Laura Kuenssberg as the BBC’s next political editor after the corporation took the surprise step of readvertising the role?
evidence: Following weeks of interviews, the BBC had reportedly drawn up an all-female shortlist. But Any Questions? host Mason is now said to have been encouraged to apply to replace Kuenssberg, who is stepping down after the May local elections

question_sentence: Which of the following were not among the favourites to win this weekend’s Grand National?
evidence: Irish-bred champion Tiger Roll retired after winning the Grand National in 2018 and 2019

question_sentence: NASA’s Artemis I mission is aiming for a launch in June. Where is the massive rocket and its Orion spacecraft payload headed?
evidence: Artemis I is expected to launch on an uncrewed mission that goes beyond the moon and returns to Earth. The goal of the Artemis program is to return humans to the moon and land the first woman and the first person of color on the lunar surface by 2025.

question_sentence: Which of these Republican-led states is part of a group of three states suing the Biden administration over the decision to end Trump-era border restrictions?
evidence: Louisiana, along with Missouri and Arizona, filed a lawsuit seeking to stop the Biden administration from ending Trump-era pandemic restrictions that blocked migrants from entering the US.

question_sentence: Who took home the awards for both Song of the Year and Record of the Year for the chart-topping hit “Leave the Door Open” at the 2022 Grammys?
evidence: R&B stars Bruno Mars and Anderson .Paak, the duo also known as Silk Sonic, took home a total of four awards at the Grammys on Sunday, including Song of the Year and Record of the Year.

question_sentence: Which team won the NCAA men’s basketball championship this week?
evidence: Kansas beat North Carolina 72-69 in the NCAA men’s basketball title game in New Orleans on Monday. It was the Jayhawks’ 4th national championship win.

question_sentence: Which billionaire recently purchased 9.2% of Twitter’s stock, making him the largest shareholder in the company?
evidence: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, who has been a high-profile critic of Twitter’s policies in the past, bought the large stake in the company. The move could signal an effort by Musk to take a more active role in the way Twitter operates.

question_sentence: Strong storms that swept through the South this week spawned tornadoes from Mississippi to South Carolina. How many twisters were reported?
evidence: The South saw at least 62 tornado reports this week alone, coupled with strong storms that damaged homes and businesses across multiple states.

question_sentence: The Oklahoma legislature passed a near-total ban on abortion this week. According to the bill, what’s the maximum fine for performing an abortion or attempting to perform the procedure?
evidence: The bill would make the procedure a felony punishable by a maximum fine of $100,000 or a maximum of 10 years in state prison, or both. The bill now heads to Republican Gov. Kevin Stitt, who previously promised to sign every bill limiting abortion that came across his desk.

question_sentence: The Biden administration recently extended a pause on what type of loan repayments?
evidence: The Biden administration extended a pause on federal student loan repayments through August 31. Borrower balances have effectively been frozen for more than two years, with no payments required on most federal student loans since March 2020.

question_sentence: Deutsche Bank became the first major bank to forecast an upcoming US recession. When do the bank’s economists anticipate the recession will begin?
evidence: Deutsche Bank forecasts a mild US recession will begin late next year, according to a new report. This comes as energy and food commodity prices have spiked since the start of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and amid concerns that the Federal Reserve will have to rapidly hike interest rates to get prices under control.

question_sentence: Which produce item topped the annual list of the “Dirty Dozen” fruits and veggies that contain the highest levels of pesticides?
evidence: Strawberries are at the top of the list of fruits and veggies that contain the highest levels of pesticides, according to a 2022 report from the Environmental Working Group. Besides eating organic produce, consumers can reduce exposure to pesticides by rinsing fruits and veggies before serving and buying in season produce from local farmers.
